III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty
to perform the prescribed functions required by these
administrative rules and in the agency’s program statement
and to provide for the continual needs, protection, and
supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth have experienced assaultive behavior from other youth and
do not feel that staff have intervened properly.
Investigation The Complainant for this investigation was interviewed over the
phone on 04/05/2024 and had no additional information that could
be provided. No specific incidents of youth fighting were noted.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth A
stated he had witnessed a few fights between youth during his
time at the facility and described one specific instance. He stated
this involved Youth B and Youth C while they were in the gym.
Youth A stated Youth B and Youth C escalated verbally quickly,
and as soon as one of them threw a punch at the other, a staff
member was able to get in between them. Youth A stated this
caused the physical escalation to stop. Youth A described other
fights when he felt like staff did not intervene quickly enough. He
detailed further that each fight he has witnessed involved staff
intervening between youth as they began to fight, not allowing the
fighting to continue, and clarified he believed that staff could have
prevented the fighting.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
he was recently involved in a fight with Youth C where two staff
that he could not recall intervened. Youth B stated a staff member
came to the two youth from the bleachers as they heard Youth B
and Youth C arguing with each other. He recalled hearing this
staff member yell at them to stop. Youth B recalled this staff
member getting in between them as the incident escalated and
moving Youth C away from Youth B. Youth B believed this all
happened within a short amount of time. Youth B also recalled
2

witnessing another instance of staff intervening with escalated
youth. This involved Youth F attempting to destroy property in the
unit, such as trying to pull televisions off the wall. Youth B stated
Youth F did not assault or fight any other youth during this
incident. Youth B remarked he brought up the incident because
he believed that Youth F should have been restrained. Youth B
clarified that Youth F did not attempt to assault any other youth as
this occurred.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
recalled the same fight that was described by Youth B. Youth C
stated that a staff member got in between he and Youth B quickly
and the fight never progressed. Youth C stated he has not seen
many other fights and did not recall any that involved staff not
intervening quickly enough.
Youth D was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He
believed that staff always intervened in physical incidents, but it
was his opinion that this often was not quick enough. Youth D
stated he has never been involved in a fight, but then recalled one
instance. Youth D stated he did not remember who the other
youth was or who the staff involved were but did state he was
separated from the other youth as the fight began.
Youth E was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth E
stated he has seen many alterations between other youth where
staff would attempt to intervene verbally, and sometimes
physically by placing themselves between two youth. He stated
the verbal attempts by staff usually did not work. He did not
believe he ever saw a fight between youth at the program where
staff did not attempt to break it up immediately.
Youth F was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
that he has been involved in fights and in altercations where he
attempted to destroy property, and it was his opinion that staff
always attempted to intervene properly. He believed this was not
always effective, but it was not because there was not a timely
attempt to de-escalate a situation. Youth F did not have any
specific instances to describe.
Youth G was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth G
3

recalled witnessing the incident where Youth B and Youth C
recently fought in the gym. He believed staff did not intervene fast
enough. Youth G described staff sitting in the bleachers and
hearing them attempt to verbally de-escalate the two youth as
they began to argue more and more. Youth G believed this lasted
a few minutes. Youth G stated this staff member was in between
the two youth as they attempted to punch each other. Youth G
also recalled another incident a few months prior involving Youth
C and Youth F attempting to fight each other. Youth G recalled
this occurred in a classroom during the school day. Youth G
believed Youth C was able to punch Youth F in the ribs and Youth
F fell before staff were able to intervene and prevent further
fighting.
Youth H was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth H
recalled an incident where he got into a fight with a previously
placed youth as they were going to the dining hall. He recalled
the other youth attempting to fight him and staff, of which he could
not recall specifically who, got in between the two youth to prevent
the fight from occurring. Youth H stated he feels like there are
fights that occur at the facility all the time but could not recall any
specific instances where staff did not attempt to intervene timely.
Youth I was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 04/05/2024
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. Youth I
could not recall any specific instances of seeing fights between
youth but stated he had witnessed several. Youth I believed that
staff attempted to de-escalate incidents first verbally and then
physically if needed. He did state he felt like staff were not skilled
in communication and the verbal de-escalation attempts were
often unsuccessful.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 05/01/2024 over
video conference. Staff 1 stated she has been involved in
numerous altercations between youth and did not believe there
were any instances where she or any other staff did not attempt to
intervene properly. She described the training and procedures
provided to staff for incidents where youth were escalating to a
fight. Staff 1 stated staff are trained to call for “emergency
procedures” when this is occurring, and that involved youth not
involved in an altercation clearing the room so that available staff
could intervene. She stated staff are then trained to step in
between the youth that are escalating as best they can, and if the
physical escalation causes enough concern for safety, then
restraints are to be attempted. Staff 1 stated these kinds of
4

situations occur every couple of weeks. She denied ever seeing a
time when staff did not involve themselves quickly enough. Staff 1
did describe a time when she felt like another staff was not
involved in the manner that Staff 1 felt was needed, so Staff 1
addressed a situation with two youth who were going to fight each
other. Staff 1 stated that the entire situation lasted “only seconds.”
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 05/01/2024 over
video conference. He stated he has not seen any fights between
youth themselves. Staff 2 described the strategy of proximity that
is taught to them in training for de-escalating youth. Staff 2 stated
he was taught that he should attempt to take the youth away from
the situation that he has the best rapport with, in an attempt to
break apart youth who are escalating each other. Staff 2 denied
ever witnessing or hearing about other staff members not
involving themselves fast enough in escalating situations.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
05/01/2024 over video conference. She stated she has never
seen or heard of staff not involving themselves in a timely manner
during escalating situations with youth. Supervisor 1 describes
similar training and procedures as described in other staff
interviews in this investigation.
Documents reviewed:
• Facility policy titled “Aggressive Behavior” and “Assaultive
Behavior” was provided and reviewed. Requirements for
staff attempts and prevention and intervention to youth who
are escalating and unsafe are detailed in this policy and
were consistent with what was described in youth and staff
interviews.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews and documentation reviewed, there was no evidence to
show that staff are not intervening properly when youth escalate to
fighting.
Consultation:
Consultation was offered for the agency to assess verbal de-
escalation tactics and trainings. In this investigation several youth
reported specific instances and their own opinions that incidents
rose to the level of physical escalation in part because de-
escalation efforts on the part of staff were not effective.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
